summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 17, 2019. It records staff observations of inmates in locked-down status across multiple tiers (L, M, ZA-K, ZR, ZA-G, ZA-H). The sheets are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain, and the date corresponds to the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Morning Watch Lieutenant is listed as the reviewer of the check sheets, responsible for overseeing the documented inmate observations.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The Captain is listed as the final reviewer of the inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit.

events.title: SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York are documented throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log sheet showing 30-minute checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on July 17, 2019.
The checks were conducted on multiple tiers (L, M, ZA-K, ZR, ZA-G, ZA-H), indicating a segregated housing area.
The log follows a protocol requiring inmates in locked-down status to be observed at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, standard procedure for prison documentation.
The date, July 17, 2019, is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC.
